duties_responsibilities.duty: Serve as an advocate for the needs of the patron, prioritizing the representation of the visitor in all initiatives.
Implement systems to gather and analyze visitor data and opinions to make necessary operational changes, address access issues, inclusivity, and promote repeat visits.
Collaborate with Facilities & Exhibits Manager to ensure the overall safety and security of staff and visitors, manage emergency and evacuation plans, and provide a healthy work environment.
Collaborate with Leadership Team to set organizational goals and strategic plans, communicate plans effectively, and participate in Board of Trustee meetings.

Supervise Museum Floor & Store Manager, Visitor Services Manager, Public Programs & Events Manager, Facilities & Exhibits Manager, and the Visitor Experience Team, ensuring museum standards are maintained and interdepartmental cohesion exists.
Maintain holistic awareness of the museum's daily operations and address visitor complaints/issues to improve the overall visitor experience.
Plan and manage reservation systems for large-scale fundraising and programming events.
Participate in local and national events, collaborate with other organizations, and represent the organization at applicable partnerships, panels, committees, and conference seminars.
Develop and manage all operations budgets and remain informed of industry trends.

education_certification.credential: Minimum three years in a non-profit leadership position
Minimum three years of professional experience directly serving the public
